channel.title: Using Cumulus VX with VMware on Cumulus Networks Documentation
channel.description: Recent content in Using Cumulus VX with VMware on Cumulus Networks Documentation

item.title: Using Cumulus VX with VMware vSphere - ESXi 5.5
item.description: Follow the steps below to import the Cumulus VX VM image into vSphere ESXi. This configuration was tested using vSphere ESXi 5.5 and a Windows vSphere client; however, the VM is configured to support ESXi 4 or higher. Download the Cumulus VX OVA image. Install and set up your vSphere ESXi server and vSphere client. You can find all the required downloads at www.vmware.com/products/vsphere-operations-management. While the OVA image you will import works out of the box for vSphere ESXi, you must first download the VMware OVFtools utility from my.

item.title: Using Cumulus VX with VMware Fusion
item.description: The process to integrate and use the Cumulus VX OVA image with VMware Fusion is pretty straightforward. The procedure was tested on VMware Fusion 7.0, the latest release, but it should work on older versions in a similar manner. The steps are as follows: Download the Cumulus VX OVA image. Download VMware Fusion from www.vmware.com/products/fusion and install it. Open VMware Fusion and click File > Import. This opens a dialog that prompts you to add an existing virtual machine.

item.title: Using Cumulus VX with VMware Workstation
item.description: The process to integrate and use the Cumulus VX OVA image with VMware Workstation on a Windows machine is similar to VMware Fusion, as described above. This process was tested with VMware Workstation 11, which is the latest release, but older versions should also work correctly. The steps to integrate the Cumulus VX OVA image with VMware Workstation are as follows: Download the Cumulus VX OVA image. Download VMware Workstation from www.
